intro: Restio casuariniformis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved restio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Its inflorescence consists of dense, spike-like clusters of small white flowers. Restio casuariniformis plays a role in stabilizing dune ecosystems and provides habitat for various invertebrates.
